content: cozybottle is a cover for your hot water bottle making this warm winter companion just a bit more soft and cuddly while giving it a crisp and modern touch from it s plain and somewhat unpleasant rubbery look & feel cozy bottle is knit in a colourwork stitch design with yarn from a country where they know how to keep warm iceland there are two stitch patterns to choose from both taken from the centuries old heritage of nordic knitting designs but alive & kicking in bright colour combinations credits go to my favourite designer lucinda guy for inspiring this colourwork a pattern by hinke yarn ístex létt-lopi 50 grams 1 76 ounces 100 meters 109 yds mc turquoise 9445 light red heather 1408 for 2nd version 1 ball 60 meters needed cc1 white 0051 1 ball 45 meters needed cc2 black sheep heather 0052 1 ball 55 meters cc3 orange turquoise for 2nd version or some leftover this requires only a very small amount of yarn for the brave and handy ones dye a few meters of the white yarn in orange turquoise for 2nd version or your prefered contrast colour or use any other yarn to give gauge cascade 220 for example as for the colours i liked matching my mc with the colour of the hot water bottle itself needles 3 5 and 4 mm circular or a set of double pointed needles or size to obtain gauge gauge 21 stitches and 24 row = 10 cm/4 in stranded colourwork after washing and blocking notes numbers are being given plain and between brackets size first one for stitch pattern a second one between for 40-42 cm 16 circumference 20-21 cm 8 flat stitch pattern b and 28 cm 11 body height to fit a typical 2 liter hot water bottle létt-lopi is a yarn that may seem harsh and scratchy when new but it softens and relaxes a lot when washed don t worry and be surprised the cozy could look useful technique if you re not familiar with it it can smallish when knit but will grow to fit when blocking be found at tutorials knitpicks com/wptutorials/judys- magic-cast-on/ judy s magic cast on can be tricky at first but is a very please do use the m1 method of forming a loop rather 1 than other increasing methods this allows the fabric to be increased on every round without any trouble other method s cause the fabric to get distorted by taking too much yarn away from neighbouring stitches find how to at www knitty com/issuespring03/feattheresa html first method named m1 the charts vary in size colourwork chart a is 10 stitches wide chart b is 12 stitches wide for the typical 2 liter hot water bottle size and at given gauge chart a would need 8 pattern repeats around from left to right chart b 7 pattern repeats around the sewn bind off by knitting legend elizabeth directions zimmerman in my opinion is very stretchy
